message.content: This question requires knowledge about the role of fiber in the digestive system and the sources of fiber. Fiber helps add bulk to the stool and promotes regular bowel movements. Option (D) is the correct answer because broccoli is a good source of dietary fiber. Option (A) is incorrect because although water is important for overall health and digestion, it does not provide fiber. Option (B) is incorrect because cheese is not a significant source of fiber. Option (C) is incorrect because eggs do not contain significant amounts of fiber.

This question requires some basic knowledge about dietary fiber and its role in bowel movements. Fiber is a type of carbohydrate that our bodies cannot fully digest. It adds bulk to the stool and helps it move through the digestive system more easily. Option (A) is incorrect because while water is important for overall digestive health, it does not contain fiber. Option (B) and Option (C) are incorrect because cheese and eggs do not contain significant amounts of fiber. Option (D) is the correct answer because broccoli is a good source of fiber and can help promote healthy bowel movements.

This question requires knowledge about the importance of fiber in maintaining healthy bowel movements. Fiber adds bulk to the stool and helps in proper digestion and elimination. Option (A) is incorrect because water does not provide fiber, although it is important for overall digestion. Option (B) is incorrect because cheese does not contain significant amounts of fiber. Option (C) is incorrect because eggs do not contain fiber. Option (D) is the correct answer because broccoli is a high-fiber vegetable that can help promote healthy bowel movements.

Of the given options, (D) broccoli is the only choice that is a good source of fiber. Broccoli is a vegetable that is known for its high fiber content. Options (A), (B), and (C) do not contain significant amounts of fiber.
